intro: Dichorisandra mollis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Its compact growth habit makes it ideal for container gardening.
